properties.name: Mount Rushmore
properties.description: Posted by Shorty101Black Hills, South DakotaMount Rushmore is located about 23 miles southwest of Rapid City in South Dakota. This monument was constructed by Glutzon Borglum a sculptor. The work started on August 10, 1927 it took fourteen years to complete because of the lack of funding for the project. But the mountain was only worked on for a total of six and a half years due to weather delays and lack of money. The project cost a total of 900,000 . Our president Coolidge thought it was a good piece of America and thought we should dedicate it which we did in 1927.The project was worked on until the death of Gulzton in 1941. Nothing has been done to the momunent since then and there are no plans to.

properties.name: Ground Zero
properties.description: Posted by Shorty101209 East Broadway, New York, NY, 10002Ground Zero is the place where Islamic terroists attacked our suprised and unprepared country. This historical day happened on September 11, 2001 at about nine a.m. Hijackers crashed two planes on the two Twin Towers killing many innocent people. The other two hijacked planes landed elsewhere. The first landed and crashed into the Pentagon. The second crashed and burned in a feild located in Virgina. A few minutes later Tower 1 fell and collasped. Following Tower 2 fell not less than 10 minutes afterwards. Thus creating what we call now Ground Zero. Today Ground Zero is being made into a memorial. They are in the process of building a tower called the Freedom Tower. They have a " Tribute In Light" which only comes on on the night of September 11th. The two lights represents the lives lost and the two towers. Ground Zero is a memorial for all those who got their lives taken that fear filled day.

properties.name: Kennedy Space Center
properties.description: Posted by Shorty101Cape Canaveral, FloridaWelcome to Kennedy Space Center! The NASA research and tourist station in Cape Canaveral, Florida! This research area was not originally named the Kennedy Space Center. The space center was made possible when the Public Law 85-568 was signed in by President Dwight D. Esienhower on July 29, 1958 creating the National Aeronautics and Space Administration which in short is called NASA.In July of 1962 it made its home on the southeast coast. In late 1963, however, it was later renamed after our president John F. Kennedy since he paved the way for space exploration by landing man on the moon. Kennedy Space Center has helped the race to space for about fourty six years now. It has launched all manned space missions. The space center has help make possible the Mission To Mars, Hubble, Project Mercury, and the International Space Station. Kennedy Space Center has played a huge vital role in the race of space discovery and probably will become a bigger aid and help to those missions to come in the bright successful future that we all hope for.

properties.name: Lakeland Christain School
properties.description: Posted by Shorty101Â Lakeland, floridaLakeland Christian School was started by a teacher named Evelyn Wheeler. On July 21, 1954 Lakeland Christian School of Grammar. It started with just 19 students, two teachers, and three Sunday school classrooms which turned into what is now known as Lakeland Christain School. Now not only has Lakeland Christian grown in students and teachers but also in the newly expanded parking lot and new soccer/football stadium and a in the process new elementary building! There are approximately 1,000 students and 70 teachers who make this school possible. We have just started a football program. Our school offers a variety of sports such as swimming, volleyball, basketball, football, soccer, golf, track and feild, and cheerleading.

properties.name: Lincoln Memorial
properties.description: Posted by Shorty101Washington D.C.The Lincoln Memorial was made to honor our famous sixteenth president Abraham Lincoln. This building and honor was made as a bill by two members of Congress,Shelby M. Cullom and Joseph G. Cannon. These two both knew Abraham Lincoln personally from Illinois, his hometown. President Taft passed this bill on Feb. 11, 1911. The bill created the Lincoln Memorial Commission was formed to oversee the project and set 2 million dollars aside for the project. The beginning of the project started in 1914 and didnt open to the public 1922. The Memorial stands at the west end of the National Mall facing east toward the reflecting pool. The memorial was modeled after the Greek Temple which was designed by Henry Bacon. It has a total of 36 columns to represent all of the states at the time of Lincoln\'s death. The memorial is 204 ft. long 134 t. wide and 99 feet tall! The sculpture was designed by Daniel Chester French the best sculptor in that time period. The sculpture sits in the middle of the memorial. It took the Piccirilli brothers 4 years to carve it out completely. The sculpture is made out of white Georiga marble and weighs about 175 tons! The Gettysburg Address is carved into the south wall of the memorial and above that is the angel of truth freeing a slave. The total cost of the project was 3 million dollars.

properties.name: Statue of Liberty
properties.description: Posted by Shorty101Ellis IslandThe Statue of Liberty was given to the United States as a gift from France as a sign of friendship during the Revolutionary War. Over the next couple of decades the statue has become a sign of freedom and democracy to all who come to the United States. The statue was sculpted by a man called Frederic Auguste Bartholdi. It was designed to commemorate the Declaration Of Independence. The completion date was set for the year 1876. Both the United States and France helped make this monument possible. The Americans built the pedestal for the statue to sit upon while the statue was France\'s sole responsibility. Both sides had problems financing the project. America finished paying for the pedestal in August 1885. The pedestal itself was finally completed in the April of 1886. As for France, they finished the statue in July of 1884. The finished product arrived from France on the New York Harbor in July 1885. The statue was seperated into 350 peices and stuck into 214 crates. It was then that the statue was commenced and set up which only took about four months. On Oct. 28th,1886 is when the dedication took place.

properties.name: The Alamo
properties.description: Posted by Shorty101san antonio, texasThe Battle of the Alamo took place in San Antonio, Texas. The cause of the war and the reason that the Mexican army even went through the town of Alamo was because the Texas people were rebelling against the Mexican goverment. The Texas army decided to meet the Mexican army halfway by building up and supplying cannons, ammunition, guns, and firepower to the Alamo. Many people came from all over to help defend the Alamo. People from groups for example like the New Orleans Greys who were there at the Alamo but chickened out and left only about 20 people there to fight in the battle. Lots of volunteers from Tennessee also came to Texas to participate in the the Battle of Alamo. The Mexican army arrived at the Alamo on Feb. 23, 1836. The Mexican army was well equipped and prepared for the battle ahead. Many of the Mexican army leaders were soldeirs that had fought in wars before which also was an advantage to the Mexican army for having more experience in the military feild. In the end the Texas army defeated the Mexican army and made the battlecry "Remember the Alamo" very famous.

properties.name: The Battle of Gettysburg
properties.description: Posted by Shorty101Gettysburg, PennsylvaniaThe Battle Of Gettysburg is one of the most important battles of the Civil War. It lasted three days in the heat of summer July 1, 1863 - July 3, 1863. The battle involved 160,000 thousand Americans. And took place in Gettysburg, Pennsylvania. This is the place where the Union Army led by Gen. George G. Meade intercepted the Confederate Army led by Gen. Robert E. Lee. On the morning of July 1st the Confederate troops ran into Union troops who had less than 20,000 . Robert E. Lee sent backup which escalated the number of Confederate troops to more than 25,000 exceeding the Union soldeirs by thousands. Heavy fighting went on and was pushed and regrouped in the town of Gettysburg. This is where Robert E. Lee attacked the Union army on July 2nd. That day held many casualties for both sides. Gen. Meade kept his position waiting for Lee to attack which he did. Which cost him more troops and for him to return home to Virgina empty handed and lost. The Confederates lost 28,000 out of 75,000. The Union soldeirs lost 23,000 out of 88,000.

properties.name: The Colosseum
properties.description: Posted by Shorty101Rome, ItalyThe Colisseum is a big part of Italys tourism and historical sites. It started being built around the year 70 A.D. The Colisseum was completed in 80 A.D. Its ampitheatre held up to about 50,000 spectators and fans. On its opening day it showcased over 100 games that involved gladiators and animals being killed. The Colisseum was also flooded to use as a stage to host fake naval battles. It took about 15 minutes to seat and get a show going for 50,000. In this way Romans are given the credit for making up tickets and assigned seating. The Colisseum has influenced todays stadiums such as the Yankee Stadium. The Colisseum was used for about 400 years until earthquakes, mistreatment, and neglect tore it apart. The Colisseum has no roof. It is a sturdy building that has a solid foundation but is open and light. The Colisseum is made out of white marble. The ceiling of the structure is 20m high.

properties.name: The Western Wall
properties.description: Posted by Shorty101Jerusalem, IsraelThe Western Wall is located in Old Jerusalem, Israel. It is the most sacred religous spot. The English call it the "Wailing Wall" because it became a center for mourning over Israel\'s exile and the destruction of the Temple. The Western Wall since 132CE has been receiving the prayers of the Jewish people. Most of them at that time were directed toward the recently destroyed Temple. The Western Wall had a permanent place in the Jews daily life starting in the year 1520. But most history books say that this is a place for prayer and assembly. No Muslim interest or followers ever go to this wall. The wall consists of 24 rows of stones reaching to the height of 18m with 6m above the Temple Mount. In 1867, excavation discovered that there is 19 more rows underground.
